title: Stan Whitty
text:
Stan Whitty (birth unknown – death unknown) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1910s, 1920s and 1930s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> (non-<a href="Test%20match%20%28rugby%20league%29">test match</a>es), and <a href="Rugby%20League%20War%20of%20the%20Roses">Yorkshire</a>, and at club level for <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull FC</a>, as a , i.e. number 7.
Playing career.
International honours.
Stan Whitty was selected for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> while at Hull for the <a href="1924%20Great%20Britain%20Lions%20tour%20of%20Australia%20and%20New%20Zealand">1924 Great Britain Lions tour of Australia and New Zealand</a>, he did not play in any of the <a href="Test%20match%20%28rugby%20league%29">test match</a>es on this tour, but played in 14-tour matches, and scored 5-<a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">Tries</a>.
Club career.
Stan Whitty made his début for <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull FC</a> on Saturday 27 December 1919, and he played his last game for Hull FC on Saturday 25 April 1931.
